laws.name: Policy and Guideline
laws.description: This document ensures the safety of the people of San Andreas and a fair, well-documented process for the enforcement of criminal penalties. This document is only for use in-game/in-character infractions.

laws.name: Person
laws.description: Refers to any living human being or individual.

laws.name: Civilian
laws.description: Refers to any individual who is not an on-duty peace officer or national guardsman.

laws.name: Peace Officer
laws.description: Refers to an individual who is, through a badge, unique identifier, or other internal police protocol, an on-duty officer of the law.

laws.name: Weapon
laws.description: Refers to any object, tool or item utilized to inflict harm, threaten harm, or utilize in lieu of a regulated item.

laws.name: Stacking Charges
laws.description: Refers to a suspect committing a specific crime on multiple occasions or during multiple incidents. Each count includes all related punishments.

policy.title: Title 14. Code Policy and Legal Procedures

laws.name: Involuntary Intoxication
laws.description: A person found to be involuntarily intoxicated cannot be found guilty of an offense as they did not have the adequate state of mind.

laws.name: Self Defense & Castle Doctrine
laws.description: Absolves criminal liability for Title 1 crimes if imminent danger exists and necessary force is used. Does not apply to gang violence or criminal involvement.

laws.name: Suspicion Policy
laws.description: Allows temporary detainment for questioning based on justifiable suspicion but limits searches to Terry Frisks without probable cause.

laws.name: Officer Discretion
laws.description: Officers may forego charging infractions or misdemeanors based on personal judgment, unless a victim presses charges.

laws.name: Good Samaritan Clause
laws.description: Allows citizens to perform arrests for misdemeanors+ and assist government workers upon request or during duress.

laws.name: Police Exigency & Hot Pursuit
laws.description: Authorizes entry into private property during active pursuit or when believing a crime/emergency is occurring.

laws.name: Probable Cause & Plain View
laws.description: Authorizes seizure of evidence in plain view. Probable cause implies a probable situation of criminality authorizing a search.

laws.name: Warrant Policy
laws.description: Defines warrantless searches (Terry Frisk, Vehicle PC, Arrest Search, Consent, Administrative) and warrant requirements.

laws.name: Criminal Threats
laws.description: Willfully threatening to commit a crime resulting in death/GBI with specific intent, causing sustained fear.

laws.name: Assault
laws.description: Unlawful attempt, coupled with present ability, to commit a violent injury on another (No physical contact).

laws.name: Assault With A Deadly Weapon
laws.description: Committing assault or battery with a deadly weapon or instrument.

laws.name: Battery
laws.description: Willful and unlawful use of force or violence upon the person of another.

laws.name: Aggravated Battery
laws.description: Battery where serious bodily injury is inflicted upon the person of another.

laws.name: Assault on a Protected Person
laws.description: Assault against a peace officer, EMT, firefighter, or other protected official.

laws.name: Battery on a Protected Person
laws.description: Use of force or violence to cause harm to a protected official. Felony if medical treatment required.

laws.name: Attempted Murder
laws.description: Taking a direct step towards killing another person with intent to kill.

laws.name: Manslaughter
laws.description: Unintentionally killing another via criminal accident or negligence, or without malice aforethought.

laws.name: Murder
laws.description: Unlawfully killing another with malice aforethought or during a premeditated felony.

laws.name: Capital Murder
laws.description: Killing an on-duty official, killing during kidnapping/hostage taking, or killing off-duty LEO for job reasons.

laws.name: False Imprisonment
laws.description: Intentionally restraining, detaining, or confining a person against their will.

laws.name: Kidnapping
laws.description: Forcibly taking, holding, or detaining a person. Includes taking hostages.

laws.name: Torture
laws.description: Intentionally causing extreme pain/suffering for revenge, extortion, or sadistic purposes.

laws.name: Reckless Endangerment - Misdemeanor
laws.description: Conduct creating a substantial serious risk of injury to another.

laws.name: Reckless Endangerment - Felony
laws.description: Conduct creating a grave risk of death indicating depraved indifference to human life.

laws.name: Arson
laws.description: Intentionally setting fire to structure/forest/property or causing fire via criminal negligence.

laws.name: Trespassing
laws.description: Entering closed property or restricted areas without permission. Does not stack with Burglary.

laws.name: Trespassing Restricted Facility
laws.description: Entering secure government facilities (prisons, airports, military). Felony offense.

laws.name: Burglary
laws.description: Entering locked/restricted property with intent to commit a crime (typically theft).

laws.name: Possession Of Burglary Tools
laws.description: Possessing tools (pick, tension bar, etc.) in a context assuming usage for burglary.

laws.name: Receiving Stolen Property
laws.description: Knowingly buying or receiving stolen property.

laws.name: Petty Theft
laws.description: Taking property worth $950 or less.

laws.name: Grand Theft
laws.description: Taking property worth more than $950 or any firearm.

laws.name: Grand Theft Auto
laws.description: Theft of any motor vehicle. Does not stack with Trespassing/Burglary of vehicle.

laws.name: Robbery
laws.description: Taking property from another by force or fear. Stacks with Title 1 crimes.

laws.name: Armed Robbery
laws.description: Taking property from another by force facilitated with a gun.

laws.name: Extortion
laws.description: Intimidating or influencing another to provide property/services via threats or authority.

laws.name: Forgery/Fraud
laws.description: Altering documents or misrepresenting facts to deceive another for disadvantage.

laws.name: Vandalism
laws.description: Defacing, damaging, or destroying property of another.

laws.name: Lewd Conduct in Public
laws.description: Soliciting sexual conduct or touching private parts in public view.

laws.name: Indecent Exposure
laws.description: Exposing naked body/genitals in public or without consent. Felony.

laws.name: Prostitution
laws.description: Engaging in sexual acts for payment.

laws.name: Pandering / Pimping
laws.description: Receiving earnings from prostitution or soliciting customers for a prostitute.

laws.name: Sexual Battery
laws.description: Unwanted touching or sexual contact for arousal/abuse.

laws.name: Rape
laws.description: Forcing another to engage in sexual intercourse or with an incapacitated person.

laws.name: Stalking
laws.description: Intentionally following/harassing another, causing fear, or violating a restraining order.

laws.name: Bribery
laws.description: Offering gifts/services to a public official to influence duties.

laws.name: False Information To Gov Employee
laws.description: Providing false info to a peace officer during investigation/detainment.

laws.name: Failure To Identify
laws.description: Failing to provide name/ID to a peace officer while detained/arrested.

laws.name: Impersonation Of Gov Employee
laws.description: Pretending to be a government worker or wearing official uniforms to deceive.

laws.name: Obstruction Of Gov Employee
laws.description: Preventing a government employee from conducting duties or failing to comply with lawful orders.

laws.name: Resisting A Peace Officer
laws.description: Avoiding apprehension by non-vehicular means or resisting physically.

laws.name: Escape From Custody
laws.description: Escaping from physical detainment/arrest of a peace officer.

laws.name: Escape
laws.description: Escaping from jail, prison, or custody of Correctional/Parole Officer.

laws.name: Prisoner Breakout
laws.description: Aiding or assisting an inmate/prisoner in escaping custody.

laws.name: Misuse Of A Government Hotline
laws.description: Using 911/hotlines for non-emergencies or prank calls.

laws.name: Tampering With Evidence
laws.description: Destroying, concealing, or altering evidence relevant to investigation.

laws.name: Introduction Of Contraband
laws.description: Providing controlled substances or alcohol to an inmate.

laws.name: Failure to Appear
laws.description: Failing to appear in court or pay a citation.

laws.name: Gang Association
laws.description: Participating in a criminal street gang and assisting in felonious conduct.

laws.name: Bail Violation
laws.description: Willfully failing to appear while on bail for a felony.

laws.name: Parole Violation
laws.description: Violating parole conditions.

laws.name: Disturbing The Peace
laws.description: Fighting in public, unreasonable noise, offensive words likely to provoke violence, or refusing to disperse.

laws.name: Unlawful Assembly
laws.description: Two or more persons assembling to do an unlawful act or act in a violent manner.

laws.name: Incitement To Riot
laws.description: Urging a riot or acts of force/violence creating clear and present danger.

laws.name: Loitering
laws.description: Lingering on private property without purpose or peeking into inhabited buildings.

laws.name: Possession Of Controlled Substance
laws.description: Possessing controlled substances without prescription. >1oz cannabis.

laws.name: Possession with Intent to Sell
laws.description: Possession of large quantities or individually packaged controlled substances.

laws.name: Manufacture Of Controlled Substance
laws.description: Manufacturing or cultivating illegal substances (>6 plants without license).

laws.name: Sale Of Controlled Substance
laws.description: Selling or transporting controlled substances.

laws.name: Public Intoxication
laws.description: Unable to care for safety due to intoxication or obstructing public ways.

laws.name: Under Influence Of Controlled Substance
laws.description: Using controlled substances without permit/prescription.

laws.name: Littering
laws.description: Discarding waste matter in proper receptacles.

laws.name: Possession Of Illegal Weapon
laws.description: Possessing unregistered firearms, fixed blade knives concealed, or carrying while intoxicated.

laws.name: Brandishing A Weapon
laws.description: Drawing/exhibiting a deadly weapon in a rude/threatening manner.

laws.name: Weapons Discharge Violation
laws.description: Willfully firing negligently, inside municipality limits, or at buildings/cars.

laws.name: Drive-By Shooting
laws.description: Discharging a firearm from a vehicle.

laws.name: Open Carry Violation
laws.description: Open carrying in Los Santos County or Blaine County without permit.

laws.name: Possession of Stolen Firearm
laws.description: Possessing a firearm known to be stolen.

laws.name: Concealed Carry Violation
laws.description: Carrying concealed without a CCW Permit.

laws.name: Racketeering
laws.description: Association with criminal org committing extortion, bribery, murder, etc.

laws.name: Money Laundering
laws.description: Hiding or cleaning funds from criminal activities.

laws.name: Unlicensed Activity
laws.description: Practicing business/trade without required license.

laws.name: Vehicle Registration
laws.description: Driving unregistered vehicle or without proper plates.

laws.name: Drivers Licenses
laws.description: Driving without appropriate license in possession.

laws.name: Driving Without a License
laws.description: Driving without ever having been issued a license.

laws.name: Driving Suspended/Revoked
laws.description: Driving while privilege is suspended/revoked.

laws.name: Hit & Run (Property)
laws.description: Leaving scene of accident with property damage >$1000 without reporting.

laws.name: Hit & Run (Injury/Death)
laws.description: Leaving scene of accident resulting in injury or death.

laws.name: Running a Red Light
laws.description: Failure to stop at a steady circular red signal.

laws.name: Speeding
laws.description: Exceeding posted limits or driving at unsafe speeds.

laws.name: Excessive Speeding (>100mph)
laws.description: Driving at a speed greater than 100 mph.

laws.name: Running a Stop Sign
laws.description: Failure to stop at a limit line or crosswalk at a stop sign.

laws.name: Illegal Parking
laws.description: Parking in red zones, blocking lanes, hydrants, or sidewalks.

laws.name: Reckless Driving
laws.description: Willful or wanton disregard for safety (e.g. driving on sidewalk).

laws.name: Street Racing
laws.description: Engaging in motor vehicle speed contest.

laws.name: DUI
laws.description: Driving under influence of alcohol (>0.08%) or drugs.

laws.name: Evading A Peace Officer
laws.description: Willfully fleeing a pursuing officer in a vehicle.

laws.name: Felony Evading
laws.description: Evading while driving recklessly (8)19.

laws.name: Distracted Driving
laws.description: Using mobile phone while driving.

laws.name: Prohibition on Hunting
laws.description: Hunting protected animals (Cats, Dogs, Whales, etc).

laws.name: Hunting Without Permit
laws.description: Hunting regulated animals (Deer, Boar, etc) without permit.

laws.name: Limit Violation
laws.description: Exceeding daily bag or possession limits.

laws.name: Poaching
laws.description: Illegally trading/selling animal parts for profit.
